item.title: How can journalism make people care about crises & create solutions? - Highlights - NICHOLAS KRISTOF
item.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning Journalist · NYTimes Op-Ed Columnist Author of Chasing Hope, A Reporter's Life · Coauthor of Half the Sky · Tightrope · A Path Appears I'm trying to get people to care about a crisis in ways that may bring solutions to it. And that's also how I deal with the terror and the fear to find a sense of purpose in what I do... Feed: https://thecreativeprocess.squarespace.com/books-writers?format=rss

item.title: Tana Ramsay on working through grief as a family
item.description:
On this episode of Happy Mum Happy Baby, Giovanna welcomes Tana Ramsay - best-selling cookery book author, wife to Gordon, and mum to Meg, Holly, Jack, Tilly, Oscar, and baby Jesse!


Tana tells Gi all about her IVF journey and what it’s been like raising 6 children (who range from 6 months to 26 years old)! Plus, why Gordon decided not to attend some of their births… 


Tana also talks about her heartbreaking miscarriage losing her son Rocky and how she and her family... Feed: https://feeds.acast.com/public/shows/93632869-73cf-44c9-bc9a-3e596d6fbe8f
